description: From Latin purpura (“purple”), from Ancient Greek πορφύρα (porphúra). The medical sense is from the English purpura (“the appearance of purple discolorations on the skin”); surface analysis, purpura +‎ -ic.

adjectives.description: purpuric (comparative more purpuric, superlative most purpuric)

entries.meaning: (medicine) Pertaining to or affected with purpura (skin discoloration from blood inside it).
examples: After 1–14 days, skin eruption occurs abruptly, consisting of symmetrical purpuric macules which progress to blisters and areas of epidermal necrosis...

entries.meaning: (medicine, archaic) Purple or purplish (of spots which appear on the skin; regardless of their cause); Synonym of purpureal.

definitionGroups.group: (chemistry, not comparable) purple in colour; derived from or forming a substance which is purple; especially:

entries.meaning: Derived from or forming purpuric acid.
